metadata.title: USN-4930-1 -- Samba vulnerability
metadata.description: Peter Eriksson discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain negative idmap cache entries. This issue could result in certain users gaining unauthorized access to files, contrary to expected behaviour.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4930-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 libwbclient-dev - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-dev - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 libsmbclient-dev - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.23 No subscription required
